title: Heavy sans (similar to Rhode black condensed)
content:
Hi everybody,  
I’m looking for the typeface used in the image below.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085159im_/http:/typophile.com/files/domarne_5543.jpg)
  
It’s from a magazine masthead, I have no other letters.  
The magazine has been around since 1987, but I don’t know if the masthead has been set in that face since then or if it has been redesigned later. It has been set in that face surely since 2002 till present.  
The similar I found is Rhode Black Condensed, which actually isn’t.  
I know it could be a custom design.  
Any hint is welcome, no need to tell you.
 [‹ What Font Is Used On The Front Of The MasterCard Credit Card logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085159/http:/typophile.com/node/40658 "Go to previous forum topic") [Moominvalley In November published 1971 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085159/http:/typophile.com/node/40674 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Giacomo Cesana

comments.content:
Even though not as black/fat like this one, you might consider Mario Feliciano’s Morgan family. Especially the “Morgan Poster weights” have a similar approach;

[http://www.felicianotypefoundry.com/main/?page\_id=20](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085159/http:/www.felicianotypefoundry.com/main/?page_id=20 "http://www.felicianotypefoundry.com/main/?page\_id=20")
